Class ServerHandler

java.lang.Object
ServerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class ServerHandler extends Object implements Runnable
Class that manages the server side and its connection to any client. Allows writing to and reading from the clients once connection finished. (Also implements the Runnable interface, so can be inserted in Thread() constructor or in ExecutorService.submit() to use the run() method)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ServerHandler()
    Default constructor of the ServerHandler object (defines initServer as true).
    ServerHandler(boolean initServer)
    Constructor of the ServerHandler object that immediately uses the initServer() method.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerHandler

      public ServerHandler()
      Default constructor of the ServerHandler object (defines initServer as true).

    • ServerHandler

      public ServerHandler(boolean initServer)
      Constructor of the ServerHandler object that immediately uses the initServer() method.
      Parameters:
      initServer - Defines if we automatically call initServer()

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static ServerHandler getInstance()
      Retrives the ServerHandler object (Singleton in _instance property). (Creates it if not already created)
      Returns:
      Single instance (Singleton) of the ServerHandler

    • run

      public void run()
      When the ServerHandler is used in a Thread as a Runnable, it enters an infinite loop handling events between the server and clients.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • initServer

      public void initServer(boolean runServer)
      Inits the server. (In fact just checks if the selector (or the serverSocketChannel) isn't already set (==connection active) and automatically uses runServer() if needed)
      Parameters:
      runServer - Decides if we call runServer() method or not

    • acceptClientConnection

      public void acceptClientConnection(SelectionKey selectionKey)
      Attempts to accept a connection from a client app. (if any client tried to use a socket between itself and this server)
      Parameters:
      selectionKey - Key from the selector that contains the data about the connection

    • readFromClient

      public String readFromClient(SelectionKey selectionKey)
      Attempts to read a message from the client. (normally should be called if a SelectionKey for reading (event) is received (== client wrote something))
      Parameters:
      selectionKey - Key from the selector that contains the data about the connection
      Returns:
      Output that was sent by the client, that can therfore be used outside of the function!

    • writeToClient

      public void writeToClient(SelectionKey selectionKey)
      By default asks the ChatBot to input some message if none was passed as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      selectionKey - Key from the selector that contains the data about the connection

    • writeToClient

      public void writeToClient(SelectionKey selectionKey, String text)
      Attempts to send a String message to a client.
      Parameters:
      selectionKey - Key from the selector that contains the data about the connection
      text - Message to send to the server

    • closeServerConnection

      public void closeServerConnection()
      Attempts to close the connection with the server.
